sen.j: 千葉 秀胤（ちば ひでたね）とは鎌倉時代前期の御家人。
sen.e: Hidetane CHIBA was a gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods) who lived during the early Kamakura period.
Hidetane CHIBA was a gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods) who lived during the early Kamakura period.

His father was Tsunehide CHIBA.

sen.j: 通称は境氏（さかい ひょうえじろう）。
sen.e: His common name was Hyoejiro SAKAI.

sen.e: He is also known as 'Hidetane SAKAI' or 'Hidetane KAZUSA.'

sen.j: 仁治元年（1240年）に従五位下上総国国司に任ぜられ、征夷大将軍九条頼経の二所参詣に供奉している。
sen.e: He was appointed as the Kokushi (an officer of local government) in Kazusa Province with the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in 1240, and when Seii Taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") Yoritsune KUJO visited temples and shrines at Izu and Hakone in the same year, he accompanied Yoritsune.

He was appointed as the Kokushi (an officer of local government) in Kazusa Province with the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in 1240, and when Seii Taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") Yoritsune KUJO visited temples and shrines at Izu and Hakone in the same year, he accompanied Yoritsune.

sen.j: 寛元元年（1243年）には従五位上に叙せられ、翌年には評定衆に加えられる（千葉氏では唯一の例）。
sen.e: He was awarded Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) in 1243, and he became a member of the Council of State in the following year (the only example of the Chiba clan.)
He was awarded Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) in 1243, and he became a member of the Council of State in the following year (the only case among the Chiba clan members)
sen.cmt: 括弧内の説明ですが、多少説明不足に思われます。追記しました。

sen.j: 幼少の千葉氏宗家当主千葉頼胤を補佐する一方で、対外的には一族の代表者として行動した。
sen.e: While he assisted Yoritane CHIBA, the infant head of the head family of the Chiba clan, he externally acted as a representative of the family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: 名越光時・藤原定員・後藤基綱・三浦光村・藤原為佐・三善康持らとともに九条頼経を押し立てて執権北条経時と対抗した。
sen.e: He also backed up Yoritsune KUJO with Mitsutoki NAGOE, FUJIWARA no Sadakazu, Mototsuna GOTO, Mitsumura MIURA, Tamesuke FUJIWARA, Yasumochi MIYOSHI, and came into conflict with the regent Tsunetoki HOJO.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He also backed up Yoritsune KUJO with Mitsutoki NAGOE, FUJIWARA no Sadakazu, Mototsuna GOTO, Mitsumura MIURA, Tamesuke FUJIWARA, Yasumochi MIYOSHI, and came into conflict with the regent Tsunetoki HOJO.

He also backed up Yoritsune KUJO with Mitsutoki NAGOE, FUJIWARA no Sadakazu, Mototsuna GOTO, Mitsumura MIURA, Tamesuke FUJIWARA, Yasumochi MIYOSHI, and came into conflict with the regent Tsunetoki HOJO.

sen.j: 寛元4年（1246年）に執権経時が死去し、弟の北条時頼が執権を継承したのを機に勃発した政変（宮騒動）によって名越光時・藤原定員が失脚する。
sen.e: When the regent Tsunetoki died in 1246, Tsunetoki's younger brother Tokiyori HOJO took over the position of a regent, which triggered a coup (palace disturbance), and Mitsutoki NAGOE and FUJIWARA no Sadakazu were overthrown by the coup.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: When the regent Tsunetoki died in 1246, Tsunetoki's younger brother Tokiyori HOJO took over the position of a regent, which triggered a coup (palace disturbance), and Mitsutoki NAGOE and FUJIWARA no Sadakazu were overthrown by the failure of the coup.
sen.cmt: 名越らが失脚したのは「coupの失敗により失脚した」ということになっています。この点をはっきりさせ、彼らの行動（coup)が政変を起し、その結果として失脚したという事実をはっきりさせました。
sen.e: When the regent Tsunetoki died in 1246, Tsunetoki's younger brother Tokiyori HOJO took over the position of a regent, which triggered a coup (palace disturbance), and Mitsutoki NAGOE and FUJIWARA no Sadakazu were overthrown by the failure of the coup.

sen.j: と、6月7日には千葉秀胤・後藤基綱・藤原為佐・三善康持の4名の評定衆が更迭、更に6月13日 (旧暦)秀胤は下総国埴生西・印西・平塚の所領を奪われ（金沢実時所領となる）、上総国に放逐された。
sen.e: On July 28, four members of Council of State, Hidetane CHIBA, Mototsuna GOTO, Tamesuke FUJIWARA, Yasumochi MIYOSHI got sacked, and on August 3, Hidetane was deprived of his territories in Hanyunishi, Inzai, Hiratsuka located in Shimousa Province (these subsequently became Sanetoki KANEZAWA's territories) and was forced to move to Kazusa Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処； 「寛元４年６月７日」→1246年7月28日； 「寛元４年６月13日」→1246年８月３日； 「埴生西」＝Hanyunishi，以下のサイトによると、「埴生」＝Hanyuと呼ぶようですが、「埴生西」の読み方は確認できませんでした。http://100.yahoo.co.jp/detail/%E4%B8%8B%E7%B7%8F%E5%9B%BD/
sen.e: On July 28, four members of Council of State, Hidetane CHIBA, Mototsuna GOTO, Tamesuke FUJIWARA, Yasumochi MIYOSHI was removed from the position, and on August 3, Hidetane was deprived of his territories in Hanyunishi, Inzai, Hiratsuka located in Shimousa Province (these subsequently became Sanetoki KANEZAWA's territories) and forced to move to Kazusa Province after being thrown out of Shimousa Province.
sen.cmt: 「更迭」の訳を「got sacked」としています。「所領を奪われた」の場合では利用可能ですが、更迭からはズレがあります。修正しました。「放逐」の部分を多少修正しました。
sen.e: On July 28, four members of Council of State, Hidetane CHIBA, Mototsuna GOTO, Tamesuke FUJIWARA, Yasumochi MIYOSHI was removed from the position, and on August 3, Hidetane was deprived of his territories in Hanyunishi, Inzai, Hiratsuka located in Shimousa Province (these subsequently became Sanetoki KANEZAWA's territories) and forced to move to Kazusa Province after being thrown out of Shimousa Province.

sen.j: 翌宝治元年（1247年）6月 (旧暦)の宝治合戦によって、三浦泰村・光村兄弟が攻め滅ぼされると、6月6日 (旧暦)に三浦氏の娘婿である秀胤に対しても追討命令が発せられ、翌7日には千葉氏一族の大須賀胤氏・東胤行（素暹、秀胤の3男・泰秀の義父）らが秀胤の本拠である上総国玉崎荘大柳館（現在の千葉県睦沢町）を攻撃した。
sen.e: After Miura Brothers Yasumura and Mitsumura MIURA were destroyed in the Battle of Hoji in July, 1247, the order to expel the Miura clan's adopted son-in-law, Hidetane, was issued on July 16, and Taneuji Osuga and Taneyuki TO (also known as Sosen, and a father-in-law of Hidetane's third son Yasuhide), who were from the Chiba clan, attacked Hidetane's base, Tairyukan in Tamazaki no sho, Kazusa Province (now Mutsuzawa town, Chiba Prefecture) on the following day, July 17.
sen.cmt: 「宝治元年６月６日」＝1247年7月16日；「大須賀胤氏」＝Taneuji Osuga，該当する読み方を確認できませんでした。；「東胤行」＝Taneyuki TO，http://kotobank.jp/word/%E6%9D%B1%E8%83%A4%E8%A1%8C；「素暹」＝Sosen，http://kotobank.jp/word/%E7%B4%A0%E6%9A%B9：「上総国玉崎荘大柳館」＝Tairyukan in Tamazaki no sho, Kazusa Province，該当する読み方を確認できませんでした。
sen.e: On July 16 in 1247, the next year of the coup, the order was issued to expel Hidetane as the adopted son-in-law of the Miura clan after the Battle of Hoji, which completely destroyed Yasumura and Mitsumura MIURA brothers; on the next day, July 17, Taneuji Osuga and Taneyuki TO (also known as Sosen, and a father-in-law of Hidetane's third son Yasuhide), who were also from the Chiba clan, attacked Hidetane's base Tairyukan in Tamazaki no sho in Kazusa Province (now Mutsuzawa town, Chiba Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 原文が非常に長いため、andで続けずに区切るようにしました。文法的には問題ありませんが、読みやすさを重視しています。「翌年」の訳が欠けていましたので追加しました。
sen.e: On July 16 in 1247, the next year of the coup, the order was issued to expel Hidetane as the adopted son-in-law of the Miura clan after the Battle of Hoji, which completely destroyed Yasumura and Mitsumura MIURA brothers; on the next day, July 17, Taneuji Osuga and Taneyuki TO (also known as Sosen, and a father-in-law of Hidetane's third son Yasuhide), who were also from the Chiba clan, attacked Hidetane's base Tairyukan in Tamazaki no sho in Kazusa Province (now Mutsuzawa town, Chiba Prefecture).

sen.j: 追い詰められた秀胤はかねてから用意していた薪炭に火を放って4人の息子をはじめとする一族郎党163名とともに自殺した。
sen.e: Hidetane in desperate straits committed suicide with his 163 families and retainers, including his four sons, by setting fire to wood and coal prepared in advance.
Desperately cornered Hidetane committed suicide with 163 people in total including his family members with four sons and his retainers, by setting fire to wood and coal prepared in advance.
sen.cmt: コンマによる分節をできるだけ避けるように語順修正などを行ないました。
sen.e: Desperately cornered Hidetane committed suicide with 163 people in total including his family members with four sons and his retainers, by setting fire to wood and coal prepared in advance.

sen.j: また、秀胤一族以外にも討死したり、所領を失った千葉氏一族が多数いたと言われている。
sen.e: It is said that many of the Chiba clan families died in battle or lost their territories besides Hidetane's families.
sen.cmt: 「千葉氏一族」＝the Chiba clan families，と訳しました。
sen.e: It is said that many of the Chiba clan families died in battle or lost their territories besides Hidetane's families.
It is said that many of the Chiba clan families died in battle or lost their territories besides Hidetane's families.

sen.j: なお、『吾妻鏡』によればその際に以前に兄である秀胤によって不当に所領を奪われて不仲であった弟の千葉時常も駆けつけて自害しており、「勇士の美談」と称されたという。
sen.e: In addition, "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East) says that his younger brother Tokitsune CHIBA had been on the outs with him because he unreasonably had deprived Tokitsune of Tokitsune's territory before, but Tokitsune also rushed to him to commit suicide at that time, so this was known as 'a heartwarming story of the brave.'

According to "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East), his younger brother Tokitsune CHIBA also rushed to the battle and died together with Hidetane, even though they had been alienated each other after Hidetane unreasonably deprived the territory of Tokitsune; it has been known as a 'moving tale of the brave.'
sen.cmt: 訳文が意味を理解しづらい構成になっています。単純化しました。
sen.e: According to "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East), his younger brother Tokitsune CHIBA also rushed to the battle and died together with Hidetane, even though they had been alienated each other after Hidetane unreasonably deprived the territory of Tokitsune; it has been known as a 'moving tale of the brave.'

sen.j: 東胤行が戦功と引き換えに自分の外孫（泰秀の息子）の助命を求めたために、その子を含めた秀胤の子孫の幼児は助命された（『吾妻鏡』宝治元年6月11・17日条）。
sen.e: Because Taneyuki TO requested to spare the life of Taneyuki's grandchild (the son of Yasuhide and Taneyuki's daughter) in exchange for the military contribution, Hidetane's blood-related infants were saved as well as the child (the articles of June 11th and 17th, 1247 in "Azuma Kagami" [The Mirror of the East].)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処； 『吾妻鏡』宝治元年6月11・17日条＝the articles of June 11th and 17th, 1247 in "Azuma Kagami" [The Mirror of the East]，旧暦の日付はグレゴリオ歴に直すとのことですが、ここでは、記載箇所を知るため元の日付が必要かと思い、訂正しませんでした。
sen.e: Because Taneyuki TO requested to spare the life of Taneyuki's grandchild (the son of Yasuhide and Taneyuki's daughter) in exchange for the military contribution, Hidetane's blood-related infants were also saved (the articles of June 11th and 17th, 1247 in "Azuma Kagami" [The Mirror of the East].)
sen.cmt: 最後の「as well as the child」は二重説明になりますので、削除しました。そのかわり、「also」を加えています。ただ、家系が複雑すぎて良くわかりません。
sen.e: Because Taneyuki TO requested to spare the life of Taneyuki's grandchild (the son of Yasuhide and Taneyuki's daughter) in exchange for the military contribution, Hidetane's blood-related infants were also saved (the articles of June 11th and 17th, 1247 in "Azuma Kagami" [The Mirror of the East].)

sen.j: が、これによって上総千葉氏は滅亡した。
sen.e: However, as a result of this, the Kazusa Chiba clan was destroyed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, as a result of this, the Kazusa Chiba clan came to extinction.
sen.cmt: 滅亡は「destroyed」となっていますが、「extinction」で置き換えました。
sen.e: However, as a result of this, the Kazusa Chiba clan came to extinction.
